I think my question was not clear enough.

ritten with JUnit 3.

Now, I'm trying to move on JUnit4.

But I have the fo=
llowing problem: I used the method getName() of the
class TestCase. In JUni=
t 4, you don't have to inherit from this class,
so I 'm looking for "someth=
ing" to do get the method being executed
(as getName() method did)

Regards=

Anthony
